explanation: Scholar's Mate! The queen captures f7 with checkmate, as the king has no escape squares and no piece can block or capture the queen.
Bishop takes f7 with check. Black king must move, and White wins the bishop on c5 or gains a strong attack.
Knight to g5 threatens Nxf7, forking the queen and rook. Black must defend carefully.
Knight takes f7, attacking both the queen on d8 and the rook on h8. A classic knight fork!
Queen to a4 with check. After the black king moves, White can capture the undefended knight on e4.
Queen to a4 pins the knight on c6 to the king. Black cannot move the knight without losing it.
Pawn to d6 is a devastating discovered attack! Moving the pawn reveals the queen's attack on g5, winning the black queen.
Bishop takes f7 with check, deflecting the king. After Kxf7, White has tactics with Ne5+ forking king and queen.
Bishop sacrifices itself on f7 with check. After Kxf7, Nxe5+ wins the black queen with a royal fork!
Knight captures on e4. If dxe4, then Nxe4 and the knight is well-placed. Black's d-pawn becomes weak.
